title: Short Science Fiction Collection 23
creator: Various
description: LibriVox recording of Short Science Fiction Collection 23 Science Fiction is speculative literature that generally explores the consequences of ideas which are roughly consistent with nature and scientific method, but are not facts of the author’s contemporary world. The stories often represent philosophical thought experiments presented in entertaining ways. Protagonists typically “think” rather than “shoot” their way out of problems, but the definition is flexible because there are no limits on an author’s imagination. The reader-selected stories presented here were written prior to 1962 and became US public domain texts when their copyrights expired. (Summary by Gregg Margarite) For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: science fiction; short stories; slesar; wallace; wells; max; dye; leiber; raphael; pohl; audio books; librivox;
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
